about.name: Jinhan Choi
about.title: Research Associate of Computer Science Department at Boston College
about.description:
Hi, I am a Research Associate of Computer Science Department at Boston College. My research interests include Human-Computer Interaction, Visualization and Data Analytics. 

 I was a research intern in Conversational AI team at Artificial Intelligence Research Institute in South Korea. I npmreceived M.S. in Mechatronics from Gwangju Institute of Science and Technology and B.S in Mechanical Engineering and Control Engineering from Handong Global University.

news.title: The "VisLab: Crowdsourcing Visualization Experiments in the Wild" is accepted to CHI 2021 Late-breaking work.
The "Toward a Unified Framework for Visualization Design Guidelines" is accepted to CHI 2021 Late-breaking work.
The "Understanding How People Reason about Aesthetic Evaluations of Artificial Intelligence" paper won an Honourable Mention Award at DIS 2020.
"Understanding How People Reason about Aesthetic Evaluations of Artificial Intelligence" is accepted to DIS 2020.
"Utilizing online learning data to design face-to-face activities in a flipped classroom: a case study of heterogeneous group formation" is published on Educational Technology Research & Development.
"Understanding User Perception of Automated News Generation System" is conditionally accepted to CHI 2020.
"Leveraging Smartwatches to Estimate Studentsâ€™ Perceived Difficulty and Interest in Online Video Lectures" is accepted to ICETC 2019.
Joined the Conversational AI team at Artificial Intelligence Research Institute (AIRI) as a research intern.
My team won the First Prize in Movie Review Prediction at NAVER AI Hackathon 2018.
The "I Lead, You Help But Only with Enough Details: Understanding the User Experience of Co-Creation with Artificial Intelligence" paper won an Honourable Mention Award at CHI 2018.
"I Lead, You Help But Only with Enough Details: Understanding the User Experience of Co-Creation with Artificial Intelligence" is conditionally accepted to CHI 2018.
